Reviews.Content: Staff were pleasant, hotel is very pleasant... walking distance to the Phoenix Mtn Preserve and our kids loved the "water park." When we checked in we were offered choice of being near the water park, which we chose. In retrospect, it's all near... a room on an inside courtyard would have been nicer and given us a nicer view of the interior pools. Our kids slept on the pull-out sofa in the suite's living room and I must say, it was the most comfortable sofa-bed I've ever encountered! I would buy one for my house next time we are in the market for such. For $159 per night, this was a great deal - clean, comfortable, spacious, entertainment all around for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay at Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort”
Reviews.Author: 1stFour
Reviews.Content: Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort was just what we needed for relaxation by the pool. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and lounge chairs in the main area around the lazy river, main pool, sport pool and water slide are plentiful with umbrellas and little places to tuck yourself away if you get there early to claim the spot you want. We had wonderful breakfasts each morning at the Hole in the Wall Grille. We recommend the Chorizo with scrambled eggs if you like spicy food at all. The American breakfast was also good especially if you have a big appetite. We were pleasantly surprised because we had read negative reviews about the food but we found it delicious. The service was friendly and accommodating. Tasty Indian Fry bread is included too-- each morning we ordered from the menu so we didn't try the buffet but other people commented that it was good as well. It's definitely a resort set up for families but it was relaxing for us to watch when we weren't floating in the lazy river which gently propels the inner tubes along an interesting route which includes an in-pool fountain. Bottom line-- we would go back. The only real negative was lack of internet service in our building AND our cell phones got no reception. More bars -- there were Not. We met other guests who like us had to go out into the parking lot to get any reception at all-- we laughed about it-- but it was annoying and for emergencies one would be out of luck. Also if you wanted to go cashless you could charge everything to your room at this resort which is handy when staying at the pool area most of the day. We went to a Coyotes Ice Hockey game and what a great family event that was!

Reviews.Title: “Nice family place.”
Reviews.Author: osu8993
Reviews.Content: Cannot understand any overall bad reviews on this place. It is a clean, family-friendly resort that is in a good location. I would go back or recommend this as a place to stay when traveling Arizona. Please read the following observations. Pool: Beautiful grounds. Nice space for a family. Lazy river was a good size and kids enjoyed water slide. Main pool was 2.5-3.5 ft in depth. Sports pool was 4 ft depth. Pool by room was 2-6 ft. Main pool was crowded at times; however, we were there during week before Easter. Pool temperature could have been warmer but kids still had good time. Room: Comfortable for family of 5, sitting room was nice with fold out bed. We have 3 active boys ages 12, 10, 7 and the sitting room helps a lot. Beds were comfy. Refrigerator was not working on arrival but we promptly received a replacement. Hotel restaurants: Pricey. We did not even attempt to eat here. Hotel is in an area where you can drive within a few miles and have McDonalds, Applebees, etc. We did see the concierge and went to local restaurants Oreganos and Diner 5 which were good family finds. There are plenty of other places to go that are convenient but recommend having a car. Actually, car is a must. Did not see any other places in Phoenix that I would not want a rental car. Activities: There is a mountain preserve that is visible and close to the hotel. Very nice easy hiking for family. We saw a rattlesnake and kids were thrilled. A hiking map is available from concierge. Went to Diamondbacks game and took stadium tour for cheap price. Boys loved it. Took a day trip to Grand Canyon (which I highly recommend). It was a long day (4 hours one way) but well worth it. Went gold panning at Goldfield Ghost Town. Kids did enjoy this and 7 year old said it was his favorite thing on trip. Apache Trail Tours guided the trip. Not sure that expense was "worth it"; although, kids loved it. Kids Club: Did not use. Misc: Size of hotel is not that bad. Smaller than a Disney World resort or all inclusive that we have been to in Mexico. We were in the furthest building but the walk to main pool was hardly anything to even consider. Even my directionally challenged husband could find everything. Enjoy the beauty of your surroundings. Did not even take 5 minutes to get to room from pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Hotel, Except for Food Choices”
Reviews.Author: Coolfallday
Reviews.Content: We ended our spring break vacation at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak, after a busy site seeing trek from Phoenix up to the Grand Canyon and back. This is a perfect way to end a hectic vacation schedule. Squaw Peak is a beautiful, classy resort, built for families. The grounds and rooms were pristine. Our room was very comfortable. Our kids (ages 6 and 9) loved it! We played mini golf and took advantage of the water park and smaller pools. Chairs at the water park filled up very quickly. They do have a policy of no saving chairs, but that policy was largely ignored. We paid $235 per night during spring break (taxes included), which was fair considering the quality of the resort and amenities. Mini golf, tennis, exercise room were all extra, but we discovered that if pay for one activity you were then able to add on other activities or services for a flat $2 fee (i.i. we paid for mini golf, but then were able to use the exercise room for a flat $2 for the remainder of our stay). NEGATIVE: Eating at this resort is very, very expensive. If you are spending the day at the water park, you are basically captive to the pool side offerings, especially if you want to hold your spot at the pool. Kid baskets (hot dog or hamburger, chips and beverage w/ one free refill) were reasonably priced at $6.25, but that certainly did not hold my kids for the entire day. Snow cones, snacks, and adult food and drink were very pricey. We splurged at the pool, but left the grounds for breakfast and dinner to limit spending. We really enjoyed Squaw Peak and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMomof3
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: We came here for our spring break to escape the cold in Michigan. Usually we go to Florida, but my kids had never been out West, so we thought this would be fun...and it was! The best thing about the resort are all the pools. The lazy river is even bigger than I expected ! There is something for all ages at the River Ranch pool area, which is good because my kids range from ages 4-14. Each building also has its own smaller pool too, and that's where we made lots of friends. The weather was beautiful and we ended up just hanging at the resort more than we'd planned. The place was packed with families....kids running EVERYWHERE. No big deal because 3 of them were mine. If I had come for a quiet week with my husband, I would have left. There is a very peaceful adult-only pool at the fitness center that I snuck over to once. The room was good, but not great. Funky smell at first, but I always bring candles. It also seemed dark to me, but maybe it was our location. Since we are a family of five, it was a little tight in the suite after a while. If we were to go back, I would definitely consider upgrading to a casita. There was a little fridge, but it didn't work very well and no microwave. THE BAD: The Hole in the Wall restaurant (yes, that is the real name). We ate there once for breakfast and once for dinner. Neither was good and it was VERY over-priced. The service was not good either. The Lantana Grille had much better food, but was even higher priced. Cocktails by the pool are $10 for a small cup and usually weak. Only once we got a good bartender. THE UGLY: We had toilet issues from the start...it wouldn't flush correctly. Plunger man had to be called a few times. Then we had a massive overflow that wouldn't stop. Our room was flooded in a few inches of water and it took a long time for anyone to come. When a guy did show up, he was not equipped to handle the job and had to call someone else. Finally, a guy came with a wet vac and a big fan. The carpet was still soaked though (squish, squish wherever we walked) and was never actually cleaned, nor was the bathroom tile. That's just gross! We were able to move to a new room after they finally realized how bad it was. I understand that these things happen, but an apology for our inconvenience would have been nice. Overall, we had a great time. We played putt-putt once and tennis once, but mostly hung out by the pools. The fitness room is nice...I should have spent more time there : ). The spa is okay. I had a massage that was a waste of $100. My daughter had a teen facial that she thoroughly enjoyed, so I guess it depends on who you get. If you like steam rooms, this one has major steam! The resort is not luxurious, but it's nice and a great place for a family vacation. The Old Spaghetti Factory downtown is not far and we had a great dinner there. We also loved Cowboy Ciao in Scottsdale~ trendy with unique and delicious food. Not so much for kids, but they were accomodating and made cheese quesadillas for us. We also went to Rawhide Western Town. It's about a 30 min. drive, but lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for young kids”
Reviews.Author: krakor
Reviews.Content: Just got back & we loved it. I always like to start with the negatives, of which there weren't many: 1) The main pool is not heated. Certainly not a big deal in the summer in Phoenix, but when we were there it was 55 when we woke up and 80 at midday. It would have been nice if the pool were heated. Note that the lazy river WAS heated and was fantastic during the cooler periods. 2) We blew the circuit breaker in our room 3 times in 7 days, without using any irons or hair dryers. Not sure what was up with that, but it was not a big deal. The first time, they sent someone immediately and they gave our child a "token" good for a prize. The next two times, we had seen where it was and just popped it ourselves. OK, now on to the positive - everything else!! 1) Most importantly, the people were great. Very friendly and helpful. 2) The kids had a blast (we went with my daughter & her cousin). They loved the pools, water slide, and miniature golf - all easily accessible & safe. They also loved the ice cream stand & the shaved ices & (virgin of course) pina colada slushes. 3) The kids camp. We always try them for a 1/2 day first. We have found some that are terrible and a few that are great. This fell into the "great" category. Not just somewhere to put the kids for a few hours while you do "adult" stuff - your kids will be begging to go back to this camp! They have a great "camp" facility with books, toys, puppet shows, crafts, lunch, and a short movie after lunch. They spend a lot fo the day outside, swimming (closely supervised), in the small playground, or doing activities like scavenger hunts (broken into small groups, each with a supervisor - who are all friendly & great with kids & range in age from college to say 55). One day, they went to one of the hotel reataurants and learned to make salsa - and brought home a nice sized container of what they made (which was delicious). 4) The restaurants. A tad overpriced and not fancy, but very good food and a great breakfast buffet. There are also a lot of good nearby restaurants (if you like spicy, try Los Dos Molinos - very casual, but great food & very hot). 5) The room. We had a Casita. All the rooms (if you figure out the shortcuts) are very close to the main pool / minigolf area. Most Casitas are also close to a small, more private pool. We tried that one day, but preferred the main pool as we enjoy seeing the activity & being close to food if we want it. (Oh yeah, the poolside grill is pretty good & has fast service). Our room was large and clean and comfortable. 6) The location - you are a few blocks from 51, which basically leads everywhere or connects easily to a road that does. You can be downtown in like 5-10 minutes. We REALLY enjoyed the Phoenix zoo - rated one of the top 5 zoos for kids. We were able to ride camels and pet sting rays and sharks (yes, really). They also have a walkthrough monkey village where there is no barrier between you and the monkeys. There is also a great sprinkler area with a "water cave" and small water slide where the kids can relax and cool off - best to bring some shorts to change into (we had some wet kids after that!). We also went on some horseback riding in the desert at a place recommended by the hotel - that was about a 30-minute drive, but worth it. We also went to some American Indian ruins. There is also a spa, but we never used it.

Reviews.Title: “My "Pointe" of view...”
Reviews.Author: Mommy3k
Reviews.Content: My "pointe" of view is from a business traveler staying at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak resort during the week before Easter (spring break).  Please keep that in mind as you read my review.  I'm sure I would feel differently if I were here with a family during this time.   Arrival and check -in on Monday evening was fast and efficient.  The place is HUGE and it is difficult to find the reception area.  Once we were there, it was all good.  The bellman will give you a map and draw directions on it as to where you should try to park to be closest to your room.  It worked out fine, and we (my colleague and I) found our rooms with no trouble. (Stay tuned though...it got interesting later when we had to extend our stay another day...)   We had king suites and they were very nice.  There is a living room with a pull-out sofa, a vanity area with separate toilet/tub, and a bedroom with a king bed.  Outside the bedroom is a small patio with two chairs and a small table.  The layout was good, and there was plenty of room to move around.  It would be a great place to bring kids as the parents could get some privacy with the separate areas.  There are doors between the living room and vanity area, and another door between the vanity area and the bedroom.    There is a mini-bar, but it was locked.  I asked to have it opened and they brought a key right away.  It is just a fridge, which is what I wanted it for anyway.  Being away from home for a week, I needed a place to store food and beverages.  I was quite disappointed that there was no microwave in the room.  That limited my food choices a lot, especially since we were working long hours and I just wanted to eat a quick something and go to bed each night! They want you to spend money at their restaurants, I'm sure.   Speaking of food...my colleague and I went to the Hole-in-the Wall grill the first night.  It was decent food, but the prices are exorbitant here!  It would have been cost-prohibitive for me to stay/eat here with my family of five.  For example, the lowest cost entree on the menu was a $13 salad.  This was not a fancy place folks...just a burger-salad-chicken-pizza type place for the family.  Everything was expensive throughout the resort.  You can walk to at least 3 good places to eat in 5 minutes or less...I suggest you do that.  There is a sports bar called Ghallager's (didn't try it), an Italian place called Tutti Santi (mid-range price, good food and atmosphere) and a deli (don't know the name) all in the same place right there. We did the deli for lunch a couple times and they're open for breakfast too. The food at the deli was fairly priced and good.   There is a Mickey D's just down the street right next to a grocery store.  Also a gas station and a couple of banks nearby, as well as many other restaurants within a 5 minute drive.  Do not pay to eat at the hotel.  All of their food and drinks are way overpriced!   Kids programming: they have a kids club where you can take them for supervised activities (kind of like on a cruise ship). The place is definitely kid-friendly! There were about a million of them there this week! Mostly little kids, but a few young teens also. Some people let their kids make noise outside in the corridors a bit late for my taste (as a business traveler). However, I do realize this is a resort and people were on vaycay, so not a big deal, I guess. Pools looked nice...didn't get to use them, but we were assured upon check-in that all pools are heated (which was laughable to us because we would not have the opportunity to use them with our grueling work schedule). The river ranch pool looked nice, and they have a lazy river. The pool in the center of the main hotel area also looked nice. I think there was a swim-up bar there and there is at least one hot tub. Parking was a bit hit and miss. When we were in building 2 (south) we had better luck with parking close to our rooms. The last night when we were in the north building, we couldn't find a decent spot. The place was full! Hugeness of it all: It is a huge hotel! You can get lost trying to find an ice machine! They do have signs to point you in the right direction though. No free internet: This annoys the heck out of me! We were at a smaller chain hotel the last time (a couple weeks ago) and they have free internet (wireless or with a cord), but the freaking Hilton makes you pay $12/day for internet (cord) in your room! This is yet another example of the nickel-and-diming going on at this place. Luckily work was paying, so I didn't have to fork over the cash. I guess they have wireless in the lobby if you want to use it. Broken coffee maker/no coffee: My in-room coffee maker began acting up on day 2 or 3. I left a note and they did replace it, but left no coffee! I had to call that night to have them bring me some coffee for the next morning. They are really fast when you call for something, I'll give them that. Service is fast. Everything else in the first room worked well. The rooms in building 2 are more updated than those in building one. For example, the bathroom in building one was smaller and had no exhaust fan. The rooms had the same basic layout, but the room in building 1 was a bit smaller. Pleasant decor and surroundings—very nice views if you can ignore the parking lot. Lots of flowers and trees. Rooms are tastefully decorated. The courtyards in the interior part of the hotel were very nice, with fountains and vegetation. Everything was kept very clean, inside and out. They had super huge, thick bath towels. Much better than what I'm used to at the Hampton or other mid-range chains. Hot water was plentiful, but the water pressure could have been better. The bed was very nice and comfortable. Lots of pillows and very comfy.   OK. So, we were at the hotel from Mon-Thur for work. Checked out Friday morning, but had to stay an extra day. We re-booked an extra night. This is where it got bad. We got off work late (a little before 9:00 pm, after a 14 hour day of work). Check in was efficient. However, now we had new rooms and they were in building 1, whereas we had been in building 2 the first few days. My room was on the third floor and as I walked toward it, I saw two women entering my room! I looked at the key, looked at the room number, and it was the right room. I knocked on the door and asked them if they were guests in this room (weird question, I'm sure), and they said yes. I told them the hotel had just given me a key to their room. They were very gracious and invited me in to use the phone to call the front desk to let them know they f*^#-ed up. Turns out, they transposed the last two numbers. They told me which room to go to (really far away) and sent up a bellman with the right key. At this point I was really angry. I told the guy this was unacceptable and did not tip him. Felt bad about that later...wasn't his fault. But, can you imagine if I had walked into a room that was occupied with sleeping children on the sofa bed, or a couple on their honeymoon, or whatever? New towels—not to whine, but the next morning the huge fluffy white towels were brand new. That is good, except you need to wash new towels before using them! I had little white fuzzies all over me after using them! Another positive was the good security on golf carts all the time. I never felt unsafe here. Well, some of the corridors were dark at night. But there were so many people around and the outer parking areas were very well-lit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spring Break Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: briggs526
Reviews.Content: This resort was excellent! My family had a great time during our stay. All of the staff was very nice and accommodating. My kids went to Coyote Camp one of the days & they want to keep going back! We enjoyed the water slide, lazy river and mini golf too! The casitas were very spacious, relaxing and with private parking. We ate at the Latana Grill and Hole in the Wall & both restaurants were good. This resort is at the top with our family!

Reviews.Title: “Unless you have younger kids, don't spend the extra money!”
Reviews.Author: SpringSun
Reviews.Content: The Squaw Peak Resort was very clean, service was excellent. We stayed from March 21-27 with three teenagers that enjoyed the river ranch/water park for about 1 day and that was it, teenagers get bored easily and wanted to other things in Phoenix. So unless your kids are 10 and under I wouldn't recommend paying the extra money to stay here. Plus the high-speed internet wasn't free, they charge about $11 and day to use it. No microwave was included in the room, just a small refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Was a Great Place however it is now a terrible place, go elsewhere, you have been warned!”
Reviews.Author: johnydolittle
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Squaw Peak Resort, however at this very moment I am at home because, well read on….. I live in Phoenix and have stayed at both the Point Hilton Squaw Peak and Tapatio Cliffs Resorts more than 30 times over the past couple of years. I usually stay for a few days to get away or when friends and family visit I suggest they stay at either property and I get a room as well. I am actually bummed that I have to write this review as I have had many great experiences at this property, however be it cut backs due to the economy or just terrible customer service I will not be back. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. As a Hilton Honors member I had the worst experience I have ever had at a property in my life. I have a friend in town with his wife and 2 kids and another couple both are staying at Tapatio Cliffs and took the shuttle over to Squaw Peak. We tried to make reservations at the 2 hotel restaurants, however both said they were booked and they suggested Aunt Chiladas which is off property about 1/2 mile away. They said they had a shuttle that would take us there and back. We had 7pm reservations and they brought us over in golf carts, which the kids enjoyed, and the driver was very nice and I gave him a good tip. We were informed just to call the hotel or the restaurant would call for us to request the return shuttle. We asked for the shuttle via the restaurant and after 15 mins were informed the hotel was not answering the phones. I too tried calling, however no answer and I tried calling more than 5 times. So here we are, 9:30pm and the 2 kids are sleeping (long day, arrived on a 7am flight) and no shuttle. We decided to walk back after another 40 mins of calling and waiting. Not sure if you ever carried a ten year old and a 8 year old for over ½ mile in the dark after a long day, however its not fun. We get back to my room and called the front desk, no answer, bell desk no answer, we tried every extension and there was no answer? What the f%$? Where are these people? This is supposed to be a full service resort. Now my friends are already frustrated because we had to walk back, but now they have no ride back to the Tapatio Cliffs Resort. I called the front desk AGAIN and the manager on duty was useless. I finally talked to a bellman (10:30pm) and he tells us the shuttle doesn’t run this late and is not guaranteed and we should have called earlier. Are you kidding me? We started calling at 9pm……..So I had to call them a cab. We talked to an operator who basically could care less about our situation and was completely rude. She hung up on me because I asked her why an entire hotel staff was not answering the phone. I called back and told her what I thought about her and hanging up on me. During this fiasco I lost my cell phone, probably while carrying a ten year old on my back. I called the operator to get the number to the restaurant to see if they had my phone and she would not connect me, her quote and I swear this is 100% true was “I am never going to let you talk to the restaurant” and chuckled and then hung up on me. Are you freakin serious? I then tried calling the front desk and operator and AGAIN no answer. Anyway, I talked to the hotel Manager today and guess what he was? Useless. He said he read the report of what happened and the hotel operator said I was rude to her? Hmmmmmm, lets see. For $269 per night this is what you get. ZERO support A staff who does not answer the phone Stranded in the middle of the night Pay for cab fair Rude people Sorry if I was a little rude, how about you do YOUR JOBS and do what you say you are going to do, not leave guests stranded and I won’t be rude. Anyway, I get up this morning and decide to go take a swim and sit in the hot tub. The pool area is a mess with beer bottles, cups, dirty towels everywhere. I am thinking what the hell has happened to this place, its like I checked into a Motel 6. I turn on the hot tub and no bubbles???? A worker walks by and says oh that’s still broken? Still broken? How long has it been broken? Oh about a week. Then I decide to at least just soak in the hot tub, I grab the hand rail and it pops out of the hole and I almost fall. Enough is enough, I am going home…. Anyway, do yourself a favor and stay away from this property, there are several others in the Phoenix area that are much nicer and have a staff that values customer service. Some of the staff is awesome here, however management is a joke and front line folks could care less about you or your stay.

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: trippingJack
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at $200/night, single in a one bedroom unit in the main building. Service (housekeeping, morning newspaper delivery, etc) was first rate. Television set in the living room and bedroom but no refrigerator/microwave. Very comfortable bed and plenty of closet space. Easy to use temperature-control unit. Choice of cable TV stations was mediocre and limited. Plenty of parking near the unit and minimal road noise - probably because of speed bumps on all main paths. Swimming pools scattered throughout the complex - try the one near the Fitness Center to swim laps. Would stay here again - even during this high season.

Reviews.Title: “Fab time in Phoenix at Squaw Peak”
Reviews.Author: traci_9
Reviews.Content: First, the location of the resort is tops. You can get anywhere within Phoenix quick. We went to Phoenix for a long weekend mainly to see the Indians in spring training, and to take my neices to the Grand Canyon for the day. We rented a 2-bedroom casita at the Squaw Peak - which wasn't cheap by any means, but I had stayed there 9 years ago, and remember the pools and thought they'd have a great time. We were disappointed by two things right off the bat - one that we only received a select number of passes (6 for a casita) and that the River Ranch was only open limited hours, 10-6, or at least that's what we were told by the front desk. We later found out it was really 9-7, but that's still very limited and wish we would have known that as we probably would have just stayed some place else with a regular heated pool and a regular room. I do have to say the landscaping is absolutely beautiful. From someone how loves flowers - I was blown away by the color and beauty. Outstanding. The casita was beautiful, plenty of room and well furnished. The 2nd bedroom was laid out strange, but it worked. It was nice to have the pools around the casita area, but by no means were they "heated" as they claimed they were. Our shower head was horrible, no water pressure and spit water at us instead of streaming. And the TV would blare sound when first turned out - scrared you to death every time it was turned on! We tried the River Ranch for only one day we were there as the other day was consumed by our day trip to the Canyon. The girls had fun at the Ranch, my husband and I played the mini golf, which I don't think you should have to pay extra to play. We already paid a fortune to stay there - they could throw in a round of mini golf. The mini golf course was poorly designed and confusing to say the least. Not much fun, but it passed the time I guess. Dinner at the Latina Grille was expensive and medicore. Although, there were coupons in the room we later found to help with the costs but we didn't go back. Just eat elsewhere - there are so many places in Phoenix to eat - but a car is essential. Overall we probably would only come back if we had a lot of time to spend lounging around and with kids. Otherwise, we'll just find an inexpensive hotel in Phoenix with a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: hickorypete
Reviews.Content: Problems: 1, Checkin - although there were many bellhops hanging around, there was only one person at the registration desk, so it took a long time to register 2. Noise - pumps powering fountains are noisy if they are close to your room 3. Restaurants - the worst part - Hole in the Wall -family style with plenty of exhausted little ones - entre salad served three minutes after main course - took back the salmon and put it in the oven for 20 minutes - really toasty salmon after that. If you could find a waiter, it took 5-10 minutes to get a glass of wine. No buffet breakfast. Other restaurant (only two on site) - had a mediocre breakfast. I should have tried the Good Egg about five minutes away. 4. Bathroom basin - plug does not work, shower handle fell off

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort with spacious rooms but beware of the high restaurant prices!”
Reviews.Author: Christina K
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this resort and loved it! First let me say it is in a good area of town. The rooms are very comfortable, they include a livng room, bedroom and a bathroom with the sink on the outside. The beds are comfortable and Hilton provides you with bath products. The only thing missing is a refrigerator. The livng room and bedroom each have their own televisions that have many channels. You´ll always find something good on at night. During the day, there is no need to be indoors since you have free access to the River Ranch Waterpark. The pools and lazy river are heated! For an extra $2.25 a room you can mini golf and use the tennis facilities. There is also a pool and jacuzzi located in the coutyard of each of the hotel buildings. Wifi is available in room but it costs around $12 a day which is not worth it considering it is free in the lobby. If you are staying at this resort, it is best to have a car because you are not within walking distance of anything really. The restaurants on the resort are quite expensive for what you get (Meatloaf for $16 and $13 a burger). So is the Starbucks in the gift shop of the lobby. If you are lucky to have a car, get on the highway and get off at the next exit called Camelback Road. You have an unlimited amount of restaurants to choose from there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Will Be Back Next Year!”
Reviews.Author: wolffpack14
Reviews.Content: For the past 4 years my father, brother, and I have been uprooting ourselves from cold Ohio to see the Cleveland Indians for spring training. Being the first year that the Indians were in the Phoenix area, we did not know what to expect. After much research, we decided on the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort. From the moment we pulled into the facility, we knew that we had made a good choice. Our 2 bedroom Casita (along with the rest of the resort) was clean and very comfortable. Everyone was kind and willing to help. Waterpark area was well maintained but very crowded during the weekend. The location was good, close highway and within walking distance to a few good places to eat (as well as many on-site costly options). Overall we found this resort to have a lot to offer, from accommodation options to activities, from the friendly staff, to the clean comfortable beds. We very much enjoyed our stay and look forward to our visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a business traveler - Everything is too expensive”
Reviews.Author: baddabingtmc
Reviews.Content: This place looks nice and has some good features - rooms are nice - but it is a maze - I checked in on a sunday and its not like a regular hotel - there are 2-3 different building - when I left in the morning it took me 10 minutes to find where I parked. Internet access is a ridiculous $12 day for a very slow direct connection - water is $6 in room - TV Movies are $16....There is no lobby restaurant or breakfeast - you have to walk too far - I got a mini bar key but there is no bar - just an empty fridge - Not sure why I would come back here - Not much to do in Phoenix period - I am a weekly business traveler and this is not where I will be next time......

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort/bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Weenie51
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week following Christmas at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak resort. We found this resort to be an excellent choice for a visit to the Phoenix area. It is located close to several major streets and freeways, making local travel easy. Although the resort was full of families taking advantage of the pool area, we found several, small, quiet pool areas to relax away from the activity. The weather was unseasonably cool, so we did not take advantage of the lazy river, but it looked quite clean and well-maintained. Our room was not a suite, but a second floor king bed room that was very nicely redecorated and spacious. It did not have a mini fridge, although. Overall, the resort grounds were beautiful and the staff was cordial and helpful. We did not dine in any resort restaurants. Our resort stay was very low cost, we felt, as we travel often and choose high-end resorts and hotels. Our total experience at this hotel was positive and we would return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but dated casita”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: Found the property very charming. Was not at all crowded. Less than a handful of people at the pool and lazy river which was relaxing. Minature golf was nice and no one was using it. Food was great at the main restaurant for light dinner (watermelon gazapacho was great) and superb breakfast buffet with great omelets. Only complaint was the maintenance kept leaving a truck in our parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent but better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: erb162
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Pointe Squaw Peak earlier this month. After reading some of the more recent reviews, I almost canceled our reservation, but it was hard to beat my company's Hilton contract rate here. I figured if it was *that bad*, we would just switch somewhere else after one night. I have Hilton Gold status and they upgraded us to a Casita. A bellman escorted us to the room and helped carry our bags in. The Casita was nice enough though the look is rather dated. There is a stained-glass window over the staircase to the second floor, and no way to block the light coming in through this window. The bed was comfortable and the main bath was nice enough. Some have mentioned having poor cell phone coverage... there was only one place in the room where we didn't have a signal, overall that wasn't an issue. We were given free continental breakfast coupons and had breakfast one day at the Hole-in-the-Wall. As other reviews have mentioned, the food there was terrible and we didn't go back. Also the cell phone didn't really work in the restaurant. It was a little too chilly to enjoy the lazy river, though the water was warm and there were a few kids floating around. The whole resort had a rather empty feel during our stay, though the casitas seemed to be mostly occupied. The staff in the convenience store were really nice as well as at "Rodeo Drive", and the concierge helped us decide where to go hiking one morning. We also liked that the small pools are open until 11 PM, and while they have a plethora of clean towels in the pool area, we couldn't figure out where to put the wet ones. We had a security issue where the back door to the casita (at the carport) wasn't closing properly. Even if it was closed, I could push it open! We called maintenance and they fixed it while we were out one day. While the door was indeed fixed, they left the other door to the unit slightly ajar when they left! We could have had stuff stolen out of the room. Thankfully nothing was, but it was beyond careless that they left the other door open upon completion (we are sure that we did not leave it open - it was obvious that maintenance was using that door while they were repairing the other one). When we called about this, they sent maintenance over rather than security...security eventually called. We found out too late that with Hilton Gold status we would have been able to use the gym for free -- the published day rate was $12. It looked like a nice gym. The location was good, the staff tried hard, and the upgrade was nice...but there are so many great properties in the Phoenix area, I'm not sure we would be in a hurry to head back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: tigerfoods
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights to attend conference @ Biltmore. Tripadvisor reviews were negative for Biltmore so I opted for this property. Overall, a positive experience, some issues. First, the good points about this property. Plenty of free parking, good housekeeping staff, rooms were clean and the majority of the staff was friendly and helpful. Nice pool areas especially for families w/ young kids. The first night I was given a first floor room (queen) in North Pointe blgd. Not close to main lobby and room was not in great condition. Shower head was broken. I had asked for an upgrade as a faithful HH member but front desk said no rooms available which was contrary to bartender who told me 40% occupancy on Sunday? The remainder of stay was on the 3rd floor of South Pointe blgd, better room(king) overlooking pool area. Room was ok for a military rate but I would not pay more than that rate. An issue w/ front desk about a fax that was sent twice, but we were told initially was not received, manager quickly addressed problem and advised staffer was new an unaware of the fax log. Property has some maintenance issues, a set of elevators under repair for entire stay resulted in some waits. Blgds have some obvious wear issues, but saw work being done to correct and staff completing punch lists. Again it was a good experience for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “huge prison block”
Reviews.Author: bazalUk
Reviews.Content: If you like holiday camp settings youl like this hotel, the only area where you can get all day sun is arround the huge and noisy water park area. otherwise the smaller quieter pools have so much shade you can only get sun from 10.30----14.00 some of the king bed rooms have no sun at all and are very dark requiring room lights on all day, check your room before you book!!! We had a junior suite (all the rooms are suites) very spacious with seperate sitting room and second tv plus a small area with tea/ coffee facility, very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: westvaner
Reviews.Content: My first time back in 4 years and the place is still great. The check in staff and staff in general were excellent!!! As I suggested before stay in the South Pointe as it has a nice pool for a late night swim and is a little nicer than the North Side. For families the River Ranch is the best. One note: I used to love the "Whole in the Wall" restaurant on site, but this time the food was not very good (maybe just a bad day). There is a Italian restaurant across the street in the Bank parking lot (sorry forgot the name) but it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It's falling apart - time for the Hilton Group to update this property”
Reviews.Author: SussexWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband had to stay in this hotel for 12 nights, owing to a business trip. I joined him for the last 5 nights before we headed off touring. Despite having a high level Hilton Honors priviledge card, he got a very ordinary room, surprisingly small compared to say the average high end motel room, and was told nothing else was available, when he checked in. They gave him a few complimentary vouchers for the cheapest breakfast available on site, instead. When he got to the room, it had yet to be serviced. Two days later, he returned to his room mid morning to get some papers he had left inside by accident. The keycard would not work. He ran to reception where it was reissued. It still didn't work. Long story, short - 5 maintenance staff members and 45 minutes later, he got access to the room. Of course, by now, he was extremely late for a meeting where he had to make a presentation. They gave him a $20 voucher for his inconvenience!!!!! The room was very tired - furniture scuffed and old fashioned, drapes faded, paintwork scratched, bathroom fixtures scoured until the base metal was exposed, that kind of thing. The desk was too small to do any work on and use a PC at the same time, it had an old-fashioned TV with a poor screen. Worse, the airconditioning was extremely noisy and the thermostat very insensitive. It turns itself off for long periods, then the fan comes on at maximum warp to cool the room down in a hurry, then runs a little more quietly before shutting off. This cycle is not conducive to a peaceful night's sleep. My first day, arriving jet-lagged from the UK, they had a water problem. I ended up having a cold shower in the morning, but there was NO water by 10.00 am. Guests were told they could use the facilities in the spa building, 5 minutes walk away. While the water was off, housekeeping 'did' the room. How you can clean a bathroom properly and hygienically without water, nobody ever managed to explain to my satisfaction. Further, there was evidence of remedial repair works going on around the accommodation blocks, and the nearest elevator to the room was out of order for the whole of my husband's 12 night stay. This hotel has a large pool and water activity based leisure facility. This is ideal for families with children and people wanting to relax and sunbathe. If you spend most of your time here, you will probably consider the property not bad. If you mostly just use the rooms, you are unlikely to be impressed. The best feature, to me, was a reasonably comfortable bed. While the front of house staff were polite and embarrassed at the shortcomings, and claimed they wanted to help with the problems we encountered, they didn't actually achieve much or offer anything positive or genuinely meaningful to alieviate the situation. The other staff members we encountered - housekeeping and ground staff - seemingly spoke little or no english and just put on a smile because they had been trained to do so. Not our usual Hilton experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Terrible Service and Professionalism”
Reviews.Author: travelguyArizona
Reviews.Content: The Resort advsertised many things such as Kids Eat free with paid adult meal, Covered Parking when renting the 2 story Casita's, Mini Bar. The Covered Parking, even though assigned to the room and included in the room rate is not a guarentee by the Resort. You will find this out after you check in and someone else is in your spot. If you want the mini bar function, Your key may or may not work. If it does not you will get lip service from the staff and never have access to the mini bar. If you complain about the parking more than twice they will humor you and send out security to look at the vechicle that is passed there. Be sure not to identify yourself as the customer who complained and you will find out what they really think about you. Normally a good deal of profanity in thier remarks. Dont even try to get the Kids eat free thing, It expired and even though you are told about it on check in and on the phone it is not real. Dont even try to bring up any issues at check out or use the room phone to call the front desk. You will be ignored, and basically told to go have a nice day. This Resort has plenty of Business and they dont need yours. I would not recommend anyone that would like to stay at a 4 or 5 star resort to stay at this one. You are lower than pond scum in the eyes of the Resort Managment and Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Sun but little shine...”
Reviews.Author: 3jellyfish
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before- 5 years ago; not much has changed, despite the remodelling! Our reasons for returning were the weather- UK has been s**te for the last 12 months, and we needed to relax and that last time, it wasn too bad! You can relax during the week, but Thursday pm through Sunday pm, dont even dream of peace and quiet- it is a resort and families do make the most of it! And dont make the mistake of thinking that when its busy, the resort might open the advertised water park earlier- it seems to be down to the "discretion" of the staff, which is random to say the least. Anyway, to be objective: Check in- was swift, but failed to identify or provide the appropriate vouchers for breakfast (identified as an issue on many reviews), and gave out of date "value" pack, which was worthless Room- no different from 5 years ago, although in the main block this time; Dusting is obviously a long forgotten art here, as is recognition of Diamond HH status- no benefit at all at this hotel River ranch- facilities good, but maintenance and consistency (water butts/cups etc,) hit and miss; Slim Pickens bar- "you need it more than me budd!" when leaving only $1 after having walked the length of the park, had a single beer poured and charged £5.50 for it! I Dont get the tipping thing when the guy/gal has done F all for it!! Breakfast- eventually having managed to get our entitled vouchers, we began to regret it! Food at the Lantana is a complete lucky dip, which fits perfectly with the service! Dont even worry about the time, just dont think about what is going to turn up- you order white toast, guaranteed its brown; scrambled eggs and bacon appeared as poached and sausages! One day, not even given a plate- "I thought I'd just put yours on your husbands!" Another day, seated at a table with no waiter at all taking responsibility for it! Had to coerce a guy to help us to get served! Lunch- DONT GO to the Hole in the Wall! Food crap, overpriced and thats even before they try to rook you later by adding 50%, which takes days to fight! keep your receipts! Seems that the Cowboys are still around, now just outlaws! Dinner- didnt take the chance- too risky! Positives: The weather is great, the pools are well maintained, and most of the staff are friendly, if not necessarily professional. Housekeeping staff are patient and thorough, except for dusting! and the Tocasierra gym was excellent, with helpful staff and good facilities. Cabs- obviously the hotel has a kick back from the cab company they use- its impossible to get a sedan, always an SUV at 10% more, but also more thn the cabs from the Ritz (from Hilton to Biltmore- $25, from Ritz at Biltmore to Hilton- $18!! Dont bother booking- 5 years ago, booked, failed to turn up; Same this time! Recomendations- Shop at Basha and enjoy balcony snacks, supported by happy hour snacks from Lantina grill; Go to Elements at the Sanctuary for a good meal- a little pricey but the service and quality dwarf anything near Squaw Peak . Manager of Lantina- have buffet guests in one area- they need little assistance other than drinks top ups, and have continental breakfast set up so that one person can supervise (if you are that untrusting), but for goodness sake, make sure that people are served within 30 minutes of seating and get the order right!! Or employ people that like their work! Sounds like a harsh review! Would we come back- probably not due to the complete lack of understandng of customer service and value, but maybe, because there were a few that made it worthwhile- Felipe, the gardener at the top pool, Sam at front desk, and Patti our housekeeper, the gym staff, and some others whose names we didnt catch- the manager at the water ranch, the guy who checked us in, and our waitress on our first and last days. Your money, your choice, but for unbeatable sun in Sept, its a no brainer; just get out of the hotel at the weekend when the invasion occurs!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: scarpa1977
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed a long weekend at the Squaw Peak Resort. We choose this resort as we were traveling with our daughter, son-in-law and small granddaughter and by the reviews written by others, this property seemed to be a good choice for kids. The property has recently been renovated and I enjoyed the warm colors of the resort's exteriors as well as the suite's colors & furniture. We had adjoining rooms; our's with a king bed and the other with 2 queens. After reading someone else's review I also requested suites in the South building (where the main lobby is) and this turned out to be great as the bedrooms didn't have the hot afternoon sun, but rather nice shady balconies. Our suites were just a short walk across the parking lot to the River Ranch. The beds were extremely comfortable..great Serta perfect sleeper mattresses, comfy pillows and soft sheets. The bathrooms were sparkling clean and nice idea to put the shower and toilet in one room and separate dressing room. The bath towels were very good quality, new and fluffy. The swimming pool area (by our suites & main lobby) was nice, with very comfortable lounge chair cushions. One complaint would be that the towels here & at River Ranch could use upgrading as they were really thin, small and not of the quality they should be for a Hilton resort and compared to the quality of the bath towels in the suites. The River Ranch was great. Plenty of lounge chairs throughout the area. The lazy river was fun and again plenty of tubes available. We rented a locker to store our personal items although we felt like the area was pretty safe when leaving sandals & coverups, etc. on the lounge chairs.Bring your own lock if you have one for the locker but we were able to purchase one for $5. The one area of the resort that did not meet our expectations were the on-site restaurants. We were warned of this on other's reviews but did try 3 restaurants for ourselves and were also disappointed. While the Slim Pickens grill in River Ranch makes excellent smoothies, they didn't seem to care at all that they never processed the burger part of the order. In fact the young man there was rather flip about his error when my husband asked for our money back. We also tried the Hole in the Wall restaurant for lunch. We were one of only 2 tables in the restaurant and the meal took which we considered borderline too long considering the order consisted of one sandwhich & fish and chips (Friday Fish Fry special). It was just ok. The waitress never came by the table to let us know of the meal's progress. There were several servers all walking around and talking to each other but it would have been nice to have gotten some attention ourselves. The biggest disappointment was the Lantana Grille for Saturday buffet breakfast. Our server took much too long to come to our table after we were seated, finally brought us OJ, but never stopped by again to ask us for a re-fill or anything else for that matter. The buffet was sub-par, with pastries that looked like they were packaged grocery store type, bagels were never replentished, lox never had tongs on plate, chaffing dishes were either empty or almost empty of hot items most of the time, eggs were over-cooked and dry. The cook in the special order (waffles, omelettes,etc.) area was incompetent....couldn't keep orders straight. Definitely needed help. What was amazing is that there didn't seem to be anyone overseeing the buffet at all. $16.95 per person for very poor quality buffet. Don't waste your money here! We found the staff around the whole resort very friendly. We had a little problem with something sticking out of the floor door frame in the area between our suites that cut my son-in-laws foot. I called housekeeping and someone showed up at our door within 5 minutes to fix the problem, so we were impressed with that. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby area but if you want it in your room, it's $11.95 for 24 hours. It would be nice if this was complimentary but this is the way it still is in many hotels. My husband used the fitness center and said the equipment there was very good. It was a very nice stay & we would stay here again...maybe next time we will try one of the casitas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suites”
Reviews.Author: EllanVannin
Reviews.Content: The suites at the hotel are of a very good standard. Our children loved the lazy river and slides at the hotel. We stayed at the pool until closing time at 7pm. However, I would suggest you put on some insect repellent as we were quite badly bitten in the evening by the pool. We tried the on site restaurant. The food was terrible. My son had the fish and fries and it was seriously overcooked, almost dark brown batter. My older son had steak with broccoli. The steak was overcooked and the broccolli was so undercooked it flew acroos the room like a bullet when he cut into it. The hotel was full of noisy, small, children so I expect if you're not a family this is not the place to be. We didn't mind this as our children soon made friends. Overall the rooms were of a very good standard, but I would say don't bother eating here.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: ocbutnotoc
Reviews.Content: We loved the casita. We had 2 bedrooms upstairs, a roof deck, and covered parking. The living room and kitchen with minifridge and microwave were a plus. The hotel itself is run down and the nicest restaurant on site was horrible. The pool area is fun, but I recommend it for kids older than 7. The gym was very small. The front desk staff was iffy. The hotel is in an older part of Phoenix with not much life and the Biltmore plaza is dated and was under construction when we visited. We stayed at the Fairmont in Scottsdale 2 years earlier and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great water park, great location”
Reviews.Author: bitnibbler
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Pointe as a family at least once a year during the summer when they have the $99.00 summer fun rate. We only live a mile from the property but our kids love the water park, and we love the suite sized rooms (400SF) with seperate bedroom and living area. You cannot beat the location if considering staying in the Phoenix area. This is close to downtown (5mi), Scottsdale Fashion Square (5mi), Biltmore Fashion Plaza (3mi), great hiking (Squaw Peak - 1mi, Camelback mountain - 2mi), and freeway (1mi). Seems there has been some remodelling in the rooms since our last stay, as rough texture on walls has been smoothed out (popcorn ceilings still present though). Also added shade coverings on the balconies, which really helps with the intense afternoon sun. We always stay in Pointe South (this is a big property with suites and cabanas, Pointe South is where the main lobby is, there is also Pointe North with a seperate pool) in a non-smoking suite, next to the pool, room 2362. This is a king bedroom, with queen sofa bed. We were really pleased with the room, as normally always get 2 queen beds (rooms are a little bigger). Room on the East side (less intense afternoon sun). Furnishings look new, and very comfortable. TVs both worked, and bed was very comfortable with nice soft sheets and pillows. My wife is allergic to down/feathers, and was no problem having comforter and pillows changed. We also checked in at 12pm (4pm normal checkin) and checked out at 1pm 2 days later, with no questions or hassles or extra fees. We spent a lot of time at the lazy river and water slide. My wife preferred to hang out in the room, and relax. We did not check out the gym, although usage was included in package. There is an 18hole mini-golf which I played with my daughter. Also 4 tennis courts (no idea of pricing). Internet access is $12.00/day (in-room) but have free wi-fi in the lobby (which seemed to work in the patio area that liked to sit in. We ate at the "Hole in the Wall", mainly burgers, steaks and chicken. Sat on the patio first night, and was disappointed with number of flies. Food was okay (kids eat free a good deal), service was a bit slow, I seem to remember the same problem the previous year. This was a holiday weekend, but restaurant did not appear overly crowded, and not sure why it took 20 minutes from placing order to getting burger and fries. Made use of the buffet ($6.00/kids under 12) at lunch. Never ate at the Lantana grill, bit outside our price range. There are a number of good restaurants within 2 miles. - Golden Dragon - very good Chinese, Northern/12th St (1mi) - TexAZ grill - excellent BBQ, 16th St/Bethany Home (2mi). - Sauce - modern Italian eatery - pizza/salad, Glendale/7th St - PeiWei - Asian food (PF Chang subsidiary), Glendale/7th St - Moto - Japanese, Glendale 16th St. - Aunt Chilada's - Mexican, soft chips (opposite hotel) - Carlos Obrians - popular Mexican food 12th St/Northern - Paradise Bakery - 12th St/Glendale (good bread, sandwiches) Fast food: - MacDonalds - 16th St/Glendale (0.5mi) - Subway - 16th St/Glendale (0.5mi) - NY Pizza - 12th St/Northern (0.5mi) - Stumpey's Pizza - 12th St/Glendale (deliver) - Papa Johns - 16th St/Glendale (deliver) - Pizza Hut - 16th St/Bethany Home (deliver) - Starbucks - 16th St/Bethany Home Grocery: - Bashas - 16th St/Glendale - Safeways - 7th St/Glendale There were a lot of people at the property but never felt too crowded, and swimming pools were kept very clean. I was a little suprised at how relaxed everyone was with the rules (lazy river and water slide). Maybe it is the end of the season, but in previous years were very strict on height for water slide and making sure used a tube on the lazy river. Hiking at Squaw Peak, 2mi to parking, 1.25mi 1000ft climb. Very popular hike, good parking. Get there early on weekends. Can also hike at Dreamy Draw Park which is on the North side of Squaw Peak, lots of trails, and easy 1mi drive from hotel. Camelback mountain, 3mi to parking. 1.25mi 1200ft climb. Two routes, East and West. Recommend West route, but limited parking at Echo Canyon, more parking 0.6mi away. Get there early on weekends. North Mountain. More gentle, can even take the paved road to the top. 7th St/Peoria, near Pointe Tapiteo (2mi). Cons: I got home and checked my bank account, and see a $360.00 deduction pending from my account from Hilton hotels (Hilton manage the Pointe hotels - there are three Pointe South Mountain, Pointe Tapiteo, and Pointe Squaw Peak). I knew my bill was only $283.00. I call and am politely told they put a hold on the hotel rate plus $50.00/day for incidentals, and should be credited back within 72hours of departure. Okay, how about informing me they plan to do this. Not experienced this before, and am a little upset this was not presented at checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the family with excellent access to Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: spinitback
Reviews.Content: I travel over 100k/yr for work and expect the best in service and quality. For our family vacation to Sedona and the Grand Canyon, I picked the Hilton Squaw peak based on location and amenities provided by the hilton website. Overall, this is a great hotel for the family. Free parking, 3 different pools, with a waterfall, slide and "lazy river" makes this an excellent location for a family with young kids. 2 restaurants onsite, a gift shop/ice cream parlor, a bar, a kid's camp, mini golf and tennis courts makes a stay here lots of fun. Rooms - we stayed in the north pointe (3 sets of buildings + villas) on the 4th floor in a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds. Overall, we were happy with the state of the room. It was clean, beds were comfortable, shower pressure was more than adequate and 2 tv's makes it easy to entertain the kids during the "downtime" between pool and diner. Parking - ample, free parking throughout. Service - excellent. Everyone is courteous and helpful. No attitude from anyone during our stay. Restaurants - hole in the wall is good but a little pricey. We ate there twice, once for breakfast and once for dinner. Food is quite good. Our kids ate free (for breakfast) which is nice (I believe it is only until labor day though as part of a summer special). The BBQ is tasty and the portions are large. Lantana canteen- not impressed. We went there one morning for breakfast. Hostess was nowhere to be found, service was sporadic and the continental breakfast was mediocre. We never ate there for dinner, so I can't comment on the quality. Spa and health club - I am a runner but didn't do any exercise on this trip (unless you count downing margerita's). I heard the health club is of professional quality, so I suspect it would meet the needs of most exercise seekers. The hotel is conveniently located near several of the freeways without being right beside them. We had no trouble getting to activities from the hotel and the airport was a 15 min drive. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families”
Reviews.Author: NickyU
Reviews.Content: Our group of 7 (two families with teenagers) stayed here for one night in early August, as part of a big road trip. We chose this hotel because we needed an overnight stop in Phoenix as we were driving from the Grand Canyon to San Diego. In particular we picked it because of the swimming pools, and these were good, we all enjoyed the lazy river, and the kids liked the slide. In August it was really, really hot, so we definitely needed the pool to cool off in. We arrived early afternoon and luckily could get into our rooms immediately. The rooms were really big, with a separate lounge area, fridge and coffee making facilities. We ate in the Lantana Grill and the food was really good, not sure why but the restaurant was almost empty apart from us, but the staff were very attentive - although there was a thunderstorm going on! We had breakfast in the Hole in the Wall Restaurant, which was also good, particularly as it was complimentary. Would recommend this hotel for families, and if ever passing through Phoenix again, we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be there every year!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleNMNative
Reviews.Content: We've decided to make Squaw Peak an annual stop. The casita we had is spacious. The bed comfortable. The amenities to die for. My daughter LOVED Coyote Camp. She came home each of the two days she was there with crafts she'll be showing off for years. I LOVED the Tocasierra spa.. except the price. A massage at home isn't nearly as pricey - but then, the surroundings aren't nearly as wonderful either. The staff was fun, and the mango margarita at the Hole in the Wall is one I look forward to having again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: jaxnfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Squaw Peak resort in late May/early June and had a very relaxing time. I had spent a lot of time researching various hotels in the Phoenix area and settled on the Squaw Peak because it appeared to be quite "kid friendly" from what we read, including the reviews on TripAdvisor. Our kids, aged 8,10 and 14 had a great time. The lazy river and pools were a big hit, especially with our younger kids. The check in process went smoothly (we booked through United Vacation.com and got a great deal on the lodging as well as the flight from Denver) and we were given one of the standard rooms with a bedroom with 2 queens and a separate living area with a foldout sofa. When we checked in we were told to check back in a couple days about a possible upgrade. I did check back, and we did receive a room upgrade on about our third day at the resort. The upgraded room was a two story casita, with plenty of room for our family of five to spread out. Much nicer than the standard room. We stayed a total of 9 nights at the resort and truly enjoyed it. We had been concerned that the heat would be unbearable but as it was Phoenix was blessed with a few days of relatively cooler weather in late May before it started to warm up, gradually. Didn't really matter to us as we spent a lot of time around the pools. The breakfasts at Lantana Grille and the Hole in the Wall at the River Ranch were pretty good. We tended to go off-resort for other meals - there are some decent places to eat quite close to the resort. We did do dinner at the Hole in the Wall one evening but the service was terrible - in fact my wife and kids got tired of waiting for the food and left - we ended up eating it in our room. I used the fitness facilities at the Tocasierra Fintness Center a number of times and found it satisfactory, with plenty of equipment - although a couple of the treadmills were not very stable. My wife and eldest daughter also indulged with spa treatments, and although somewhat pricey, they did find them enjoyable. The River Ranch was the big hit of our vacation, and there was never a problem finding lounge chairs, towels, etc. - although getting service at your lounge chair on the weekend days can be a bit frustrating due to the volume of people. We also took the free shuttle over to the Tapatio Cliffs resort on a couple occassions. The main pool area at that resort is also quite nice, and I found the bar area actually a little livlier. The fact that we could use the facilities of both resorts is a real plus in my mind. I travel quite a bit both domestically and internationally, and while the Squaw Peak is a nice place, with decent amenities and mostly very good service, I would not rate it a premier resort. That said the "value for money" was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-very big!”
Reviews.Author: Bodyandsoul
Reviews.Content: We had a great room-no problems. Stayed for 5 nights for a conference held on the property. Only complaint: it was beyond hot the whole week but the pools were warm! It was like taking a bath; we swam at night but it wasn't very refreshing. On our last night we heard that one of the pools on the other side of the property was much cooler but it was too late to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Need's some TLC”
Reviews.Author: BigSausage
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of days with the Grand Kids and over all had a good time. The water park kept the boy's busy for most of the day and kept us out of what was a old tired room. The facility itself was good, the staff and every employee we needed to encounter treated us with respect. Spending a lot of time in the water park I did notice some problems and the first being people being there that had no business being there, my impression was that only guest that were book at the hotel are allowed to use the water park. Over all I would recommend this hotel for people with kids who need to burn off some energy but would think twice if I were staying there alone or as a couple. The room we were in was outdated with 60's decor and some carpeting that was suspect at best.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hilton we've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: arithecat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a two week trip including Sedona, the Hopi Reservation, Durango, Co, and Phoenix. We are HiltonRewards members and used out points to stay at the Hilton in Sedona (fabulous), the DoubleTree in Durango, (wonderful), and the Point Hilton Squaw Peak Resort in Phoenix...not so much. First of all, the air didn't work - it was 112 when we got there. Nothing was ever done. Second, we had ANTS...everywhere. The blinds didn't work and the housekeeper kept moving our things around to where she wanted them. The resort itself seemed run down. The pictures made it look much larger than it is. A "professional" miniature golf course winds around the lazy river at River ranch and inner tubes covered the whole golf course. We, along with several other people couldn't even follow where the holes were. One minute you were on top of a hill, and the next minute you had to cross over a hole someone else was playing to get to your next hole. While we were there, they also had an adolescent basketball conference. Banging of doors, yelling, running up and down the stairs, and yes, one night some kids tried to break into our room. Unfortunately, I was in it! I chased them down the corridor and made sure they understood I didn't find their attempts funny. All, in all, not the most relaxing time. I must say, however, that the HIlton in Sedona was absolutely fantastic, as was the DoubleTree in Durango, Co. My husband and I have stayed at Hiltons for years and the Squaw Peak resort was the worst Hilton we've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: ClanHenry1
Reviews.Content: So, I decided for my birthday, I wanted to go away (but not out of town) for a weekend. I picked the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak because it claimed to have some really good deals for a pretty decent price. Well, let me tell you - going to a resort in the off season, is not all it's cracked up to be! When we checked in, the staff were NOT friendly, no one offered any help with baggage, and they did not give us the coupon book we were supposed to get or our $50 dinner coupons. Our room was okay, but the shower/tub did not drain. Our neighbors were packed about 20 to a room and there were constantly huge bags of garbage sitting out in front of their door. None of the elevators worked (we were on the 3rd floor) and none of the ice machines worked. The pool areas were nice enough - of course, when we got there, we couldn't get tubes for the lazy river because the pump to blow them up was broken. It just seemed like everything was broken or out of order. When we asked the person at the front desk about the coupons we never got and the dinner vouchers, he was completely unhelpful and pretty much told us, "Sorry 'bout it - it was your responsibility." No, actually is wasn't my responsibility, I don't work there!! So, if you're planning on staying here, you might want to reconsider - the staff are not very friendly, and definitely do not feel they should go out of their way to accomodate you. I can say that both nights we ate at the Lantana Grille lounge and the food was very good and our server was an absolute joy! But we probably will not stay here again - or advise anyone else to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Cool spot in hot desert”
Reviews.Author: withliberty
Reviews.Content: Lots of families enjoying the pool scene during a 110 degree summer. There are several swimming pools, which makes it nice for children of any age. I traveled with my 8 and 3 year olds, and they felt safe throughout the property. We hired a Town Car to and from the airport ($30 each way), then rented a nice Toyota for a couple of days from the on-site Beverly Hills Rental Car (competitive rates - no need to wait in line at the airport). Food prices and food were OK - one child eats free with adult entree purchase, and you can expect resort prices. There is a grocery store and pharmacy about half a mile from the resort - stock up on goods there. Free shuttle service to the other Pointe Hilton resort. That one had tremendous views of the city, but the famed Different Point of View restaurant was closed when we went. Downsides? Only a small mini-bar fridge in the room. We didn't see a concierge until the day we left. The building itself was not really all that impressive. Overall - great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family !”
Reviews.Author: yopopso
Reviews.Content: We live only a few blocks from this resort so my neighbors and I took advantage of the summer rates and booked a "Casita" that included two bedrooms (2 queens and 1 king) and a downstairs (livingroom, dining, kitchen, powder room, etc..). We had 6 adults and three kids. Plenty of room for all. The kitchen came with a half size fridge so we could store drinks, food, etc... and not have to pay the resort prices all the time. The casita was nice and located on a little street that resembled a real neighborhood with the houses, tree lined streets and carports. This weekend over the 4th of July was very popular and the number of guests must have been approaching capacity. However, the number of seperated pool areas, restaurants, activity areas spread everyone out so no single area was overcrowded. Everyone had a very nice time, especially the little ones. The main pool could use a bit of a face lift but that is the only thing that needed some improvement. The service was excellent. I think they must have required everyone on the payroll to work that weekend as there were staff constantly running somewhere doing something. Towels were always stocked, food service was served hot and with as smile, staff members regularly asked if there was anything else the could do, the rooms were cleaned well and on time, we all felt very well taken care of. I would certainly return to this resort in the future and give it 4 stars (above average).

Reviews.Title: “Decent property, not great for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: lac14
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hilton Squaw Peak for a week on a business stay, and thought it was a decent looking property, but not at all set up to my unique needs as a business traveler. - The property is really spread out: it is a car ride or five minute walk to get from registration to my room, and another walk to the gym or pool. - No concierge lounge: if you want to have a breakfast and are used to hotels having a concierge lounge for Diamond VIP travelers, you'll have to go to the restaurant and be seated, which is a lot slower when you just need to grab and go. - Gym closes early: it runs from 5am until 8:30, which just doesn't work for me as I often want to work out after 9 or 10pm after a long day of work or after dinner. - No lap pool: there is a pool large enough to do laps, but I tried to enter at 5:30am and they said it doesn't open until 8am. Again does not work for the schedule of a business traveler. So the hotel may work for you if you are on vacation with your family, but as I spend many nights a year in a hotel, this hotel lacks the basic amenities that I look for in a hotel to meet my needs for convenience and exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Made for a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the resort and loved it. We have two boys, 7 and 9, and they had so much fun just swimming! The rooms are nice and spacious, and the grounds were clean. There were always clean towels available at the pools. Housekeeping was timely and did a good job of keeping our room tidy. Check in and Check out were easy. My only recommendations to the hotel would be to offer free high speed internet connections and possibly consider putting microwaves and/or minifridges in the rooms. We were so pleased we will be back for future vacations. I would highly recommend this resort to families with children of all ages as there is a toddler pool, a water slide, and two bigger pools to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: MacMoose
Reviews.Content: I was traveling as a single woman, and found this hotel more than satisfactory on most counts. I stayed in South Pointe, and was a little nervous about using the elevator at night because the lighting was so poor both from the parking area and, especially, up on the 4th floor. I hope they will consider improving the lighting as soon as possible. As for my suite, I couldn't have been more comfortable. Even the prints on the walls were interesting and atttractive. I felt pampered with the bedding, the furniture, and my own living room. Early in the morning, I enjoyed the canopy view of the tree-tops from my balcony, and even took some pictures of the birds in the trees. The water park was awesome!! Even grown-ups without kids were enjoying the pools and the lazy river. The big pool with the waterfall was wonderful, and you could quickly cool off under that. Prices at the Slim Pickens Grill were rather high - $16 for a hot dog and a pina colada smoothie, but it was convenient. The Hole in the Wall restaurant was very good. I had a nice dinner of ribs (mouth-watering), with the best biscuits I've had in a long time. Breakfast was also good, and the staff was very friendly. The conciege was very helpful, and had printed-out directions for the Heard Museum and the Car Rental Return at the airport. The location of the hotel made it easy to travel anywhere in the area. All in all, I had a great stay, and would definitely return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: chris_cmr68
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 24th of may, and first impressions were average. Nothing really stood out. As it was bank holiday in America, the hotel was packed full of people, and out rooms had to be moved, so they upgraded us to 'Palacio del Este' which was abesolutely georgous. The service is outstanding, but the hotel in general was poor. The River Ranch was full and there were a school full of kids going there on a trip, which i found abesolutely outrageous as its a hotel not a theme park! I would reccomend going to eat at 'Gallahers' opposite the hotel, which is a sports bar. The Fasion square mall and Chandler mall are also great.

Reviews.Title: “This Was a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lchjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main building at the Squaw Peak for three days in April, and took advantage of a Spring special at $99/night (Sunday night stay required). At this rate, the resort was a very good value. It shows some age on the exterior courtyards, and should not be considered a true luxury property. But our double queen suite was very nicely furnished and quiet. The concierges and other staff were quite positive in their approach to guests. This would be a good place for a vacation with kids, as the free water park includes several large pools, a waterfall, and one of the longest lazy rivers we've ever seen. Each of the buildings also has its separate pool. Another plus for me was that the hotel is very close to the Arizona Canal, which is a great place to run or bike. One negative is that this hotel, unlike the other Pointe Hilton resorts in the area, does not have a gourmet restaurant. Its two restaurants are just average. The service at one of the restaurants at breakfast was so bad that I complained to the manager and we got our meal free. The other restaurant (at the water park) was fine for breakfast.
